definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Here's just some lame extra footy.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的只是一些跛腳的額外無足輕重。

sentences.english: Having been laughed at for his lameness, the boy became shy and inhibited.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩因跛腳被人譏笑，變得羞怯而壓抑。

sentences.english: The crippled child tumbled down the stairs and was badly hurt。
sentences.chinese: 那個跛腳的小孩從樓梯上跌下來，傷得很重。

sentences.english: The crippled child tumbled down the stairs and were badly hurt.
sentences.chinese: 那個跛腳的小孩從樓梯上跌下來，傷得很重。

sentences.english: Socrates gives a rather lame response.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格拉底給了一個跛腳的回答。

sentences.english: Were it me, I would also had the ame suspection of this unexpected mysterious visitor.
sentences.chinese: 如果我，我也有懷疑的跛腳意想不到的神祕訪客。

sentences.english: Whether a horse is lame can depend on the location of the cartilage abnormality and the level of work the horse is doing.
sentences.chinese: 馬是否跛腳，取決於軟骨異常的位置和馬所做的工作。

sentences.english: The lame man needs a stick when he walks.
sentences.chinese: 那跛腳男子走路時需藉助柺棍。

sentences.english: I thought the guy with the gimpy leg should be deciding when we rest.
sentences.chinese: 我想跛腳的那個男人才應該決定哪裏休息。

sentences.english: The immigration system is a shambles.
sentences.chinese: 整個移民系統確實是“跛腳”系統。

definition: fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to heave a sigh of relief
